meanings.definition: A carved or cast figure of a person or animal, especially one that is life-size or larger, made from marble, bronze, or other material.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed ancient statues of kings and queens.
meanings.sent2: Tourists often take photos with famous statues in the park.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel climbed the statue of a lion in the square.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as solid as the marble statues in the courtyard.
meanings.sent5: The artist's skill brought the statues to life in the eyes of the visitors.

meanings.definition: A representation of a person or animal in a work of art, typically made of stone or metal.
meanings.sent1: The garden was adorned with beautiful statues of angels.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor created a stunning statue of a horse in the park.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended the statue of a knight was a real guard.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was as strong as the metal statues in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The statue of liberty stands tall as a symbol of freedom and hope.

meanings.definition: A law or decree enacted by a legislative body.
meanings.sent1: The new statue aimed to protect the rights of workers.
meanings.sent2: The city council passed a controversial statue on public gatherings.
meanings.sent3: The silly rumor claimed a statue required everyone to wear hats on Tuesdays.
meanings.sent4: The strict rule felt as heavy as a legislative statue on the citizens.
meanings.sent5: The proposed statue would bring significant changes to the community.
